reviews.text: We stayed at this B&B for three nights on a short trip to Rome, and had an incredible time. Tucked away from the busy Roman streets, our room was the perfect sanctuary after a long day of exploring. All rooms face an open courtyard, which really reduces noise levels and makes you feel like you are a local, rather than a tourist. The room was very pleasant and decently sized for Europe. We had a full bathroom and two beds. Everything was meticulously cleaned. When we woke up in the mornings, the breakfast would be laid out for us: several kinds of toast and pastry, spreads such as patte and peanut butter, espresso and juice. It always kept us going until lunch! The room-keeper, Tom, was very helpful with directions and good restaurants. Also, the B&B was in an excellent location: a few blocks from the Termini, right around the corner from a metro station, and about a 15-minute walk to the Coliseum and Forum. For around €120 per night for a triple room, it met all of our requirements and more. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: Still working out some kincks but has good potential. Right by a metro stop and a close walk to the train stations, this B & B is up and coming. The rooms are nice size, breakfast is simple but got us through till lunch. The entire place was newly redecorated and was all up to date.
